oai_dc:dc.dc:subject: Poetry; Barbed wire
World War, 1939-1945 -- Europe; Prisoners of war; Diaries
oai_dc:dc.dc:description: This page in Mitchener's POW diary from World War II shows the remainder of a poem called "The Last of the Bombardiers," which begins on the previous page. The poem is about an old man who once was a bombardier.

Hardy A. Mitchener, Jr. was taken prisoner during World War II after a bombing mission in Germany. He served as a second lieutenant in the 509th Bombardment Squadron, 351st Bombardment Group, 8th Air Force. His B-17G had bombed the aircraft plant in Oschersleben and was headed back to England when it was shot down and the crew captured by the Germans. Mitchener was sent to Stalag Luft III in Sagan, Germany, now a part of Poland.
oai_dc:dc.dc:creator: Mitchener, Hardy A., 1919-1957
